info.ryankenney.jasync_driver

Class JasyncDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.ryankenney.jasync_driver.JasyncDriver

  • public class JasyncDriver
extends Object
    The central class of the jasync-driver library. See https://github.com/ryankenney/jasync-driver for more information about usage.
    Author:
    rkenney

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(DriverBody driverBody)
             throws UnstableConditionsException
        Executes the asynchronous/synchronous logic defined within the provided DriverBody. Note that this method will return as soon as the first asynchronous task within the DriverBody is started. If you need to respond to completion of the entire DriverBody, provide a callback to execute(DriverBody, Runnable).
        Parameters:
        driverBody - The asynchronous/synchronous logic to execute.
        Throws:
        UnstableConditionsException - If, on recursive executions of the DriverBody (during asynchronous lulls) the execution path through DriverBody.run() changes. This generally indicates that DriverBody.run() is accessing non-local variables that are changing, and the access to those variables should be wrapped in AsyncTask/ SyncTask object(s).

      • execute

        public void execute(DriverBody driverBody,
                    Runnable onComplete)
             throws UnstableConditionsException
        Executes the asynchronous/synchronous logic defined within the provided DriverBody. Executes the provided Runnable when the final Task is complete. Note that this method will return as soon as the first asynchronous task within the DriverBody is started, thus the need for the Runnable.
        Parameters:
        driverBody - The asynchronous/synchronous logic to execute.
        onComplete - The callback to execute when the final Task is complete. If null, ignored.
        Throws:
        UnstableConditionsException - If, on recursive executions of the DriverBody (during asynchronous lulls) the execution path through DriverBody.run() changes. This generally indicates that DriverBody.run() is accessing non-local variables that are changing, and the access to those variables should be wrapped in AsyncTask/ SyncTask object(s).

      • execute

        public <A,R> R execute(Task<A,R> task)

        Executes the provided AsyncTask/SyncTask. This method should only be used within the body of a DriverBody that will be subsequently be execute(DriverBody)'d by this object.

        More technically, this method only executes the provided Task if the Task has not yet been executed since the DriverBody was launched via execute(DriverBody). After that, each execution of this method returns the cached return value for the Task. This is part of the illusion that makes asynchronous actions look synchronous to the developer.

        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of argument that the Task accepts. Probably set to Void when using this particular method since no argument is provided.
        R - The type of result the Task generates.
        Parameters:
        task - The AsyncTask/SyncTask to execute
        Returns:
        The value returned by the task.
        Throws:
        UnstableConditionsException - If, on recursive executions of the DriverBody (during asynchronous lulls) the execution path through DriverBody.run() changes. This generally indicates that DriverBody.run() is accessing non-local variables that are changing, and the access to those variables should be wrapped in AsyncTask/ SyncTask object(s).

      • execute

        public <A,R> R execute(Task<A,R> task,
                       A arg)
                throws UnstableConditionsException

        Executes the provided AsyncTask/SyncTask against the provided argument. This method should only be used within the body of a DriverBody that will be subsequently be execute(DriverBody)'d by this object.

        More technically, this method only executes the provided Task if the Task has not yet been executed since the DriverBody was launched via execute(DriverBody). After that, each execution of this method returns the cached return value for the Task. This is part of the illusion that makes asynchronous actions look synchronous to the developer.

        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of argument that the Task accepts.
        R - The type of result the Task generates.
        Parameters:
        task - The AsyncTask/SyncTask to execute
        arg - The argument to pass to the task.
        Returns:
        The value returned by the task.
        Throws:
        UnstableConditionsException - If, on recursive executions of the DriverBody (during asynchronous lulls) the execution path through DriverBody.run() changes. This generally indicates that DriverBody.run() is accessing non-local variables that are changing, and the access to those variables should be wrapped in AsyncTask/ SyncTask object(s).
